# location

**Instance Property**

The corner of the screen to display the access point.

## Declaration

```swift
var location: GKAccessPoint.Location { get set }
```

## Discussion

Use this property to set one of four corners to display the access point in your game. The default for left-to-right languages is the upper-left corner, and for right-to-left languages, it’s the upper-right corner.

If the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKAccessPoint/parentWindow] property is `nil` for volumetric and immersive visionOS games, GameKit doesn’t use the [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/GKAccessPoint/location-swift.property] property. For more information, see [doc://com.apple.gamekit/documentation/GameKit/adding-an-access-point-to-your-game#Configure-the-access-point-on-visionOS].

## Managing the location

- **GKAccessPoint.Location**: Specifies the corner of the screen to display the access point.
- **frameInScreenCoordinates**: The frame of the access point in screen coordinates.
- **parentWindow**: The window that contains the access point.
